data.title: Artificial tendons give muscle-powered robots a boost
data.description: MIT engineers developed artificial tendons that could connect robotic skeletons and biological muscle tissue. Made from tough and flexible hydrogel, the tendons could be used in various bio-hybrid robots.
data.site_name: MIT News | Massachusetts Institute of Technology
data.keywords: MIT MechE, Ritu Raman, Xuanhe Zhao, Martin Culpepper, soft robotics, biohybrid robotics, muscle-tendon unit, muscle-powered robots, Mechanical engineering, hydrogel
